User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the GeminiEstimate application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user, same as Firebase Auth UID.

photoURL.description: URL of the user's profile photo.

creationTime.description: Timestamp of when the user account was created.

role.description: The role of the user, can only be 'Admin' or 'Client'.

Project.title: Project
Project.description: Represents a construction project created by an Admin for a Client.

userId.description: Reference to the User (Client) who owns the project.

projectNumber.description: Custom identifier for the project (e.g., AIS/101).

autoGeneratedDescription.description: An auto-generated description based on the selected services.

clientName.description: Name of the client for this project.

clientEmail.description: Email of the client for this project.

clientPhone.description: Contact phone number of the client.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the project was created.

numberOfStories.description: The total number of stories or floors for the building (e.g., 5 for G+4).

services.description: List of services selected for the project.

billing.description: Billing details for the project services.

DailyAttendance.title: DailyAttendance
DailyAttendance.description: Represents a daily aggregate record of laborer attendance for a project.

id.description: Unique identifier for the attendance record.

date.description: The date of the attendance record.

numberOfLaborers.description: The total number of laborers who worked on this day.

wagePerLaborer.description: The average daily wage for a single laborer on this day.

PaymentTransaction.title: PaymentTransaction
PaymentTransaction.description: Records a financial transaction for a project, can be an expense or an income/payment.

projectId.description: Reference to the Project this transaction belongs to.

description.description: A brief description of the transaction.

relatedTo.description: Optional reference to another entity, e.g., Laborer ID for a labor payment.

MaterialItem.title: MaterialItem
MaterialItem.description: Represents a type of construction material.

id.description: Unique identifier for the material type.

name.description: Name of the material (e.g., 'Cement', '16mm Steel Rod').

marketPrice.description: The current market price per unit.

status.description: The stock status of the material.

MaterialProposal.title: MaterialProposal
MaterialProposal.description: A proposal from a Client to add or update a material's price.

materialName.description: Name of the material being proposed.

proposedPrice.description: The new price suggested by the client.

unit.description: The measurement unit for the material.

justification.description: Reasoning provided by the client for the change.

submittedBy.description: The UID of the client who submitted the proposal.

definition.description: Stores user profile and role information. Admins can create users, but only with the 'Client' role.
Stores all projects. Admins create projects for clients. Access is controlled by rules based on user role and project's userId field.
Stores daily aggregate attendance records for a specific project.
Stores all financial transactions for a specific project. Writable by an admin. Readable by the project client.
Central collection for all material types and their prices. Accessible only by Admins.
Proposals from clients for new materials or price changes. Writable by clients, managed by Admins.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore data structure is designed for a strict Admin-Client Role-Based Access Control (RBAC). The /users collection stores user roles. Admins create projects in the root /projects collection, assigning a client's userId. Security rules ensure clients can only access their own projects by checking request.auth.uid == resource.data.userId. Daily Attendances and Transactions are now nested under each project, which simplifies security rules and makes data project-specific. Admins have full access, while clients can only read data within their assigned project.
